meanings.definition: Preserve or store (something) for an extended period of time without using it.
meanings.sent1: After winter, I am mothballing my heavy coat until next year.
meanings.sent2: The museum is mothballing the ancient artifacts to protect them from damage.
meanings.sent3: I am mothballing my old toys in the attic, like a time capsule.
meanings.sent4: She is mothballing her memories of childhood, keeping them safe in her heart.
meanings.sent5: Mothballing the recipe book, she vowed to pass it down to her grandchildren one day.

meanings.definition: The act of putting something into storage for an extended period of time.
meanings.sent1: Mothballing of the furniture was necessary during the renovation.
meanings.sent2: The mothballing of the ship was a temporary measure to save costs.
meanings.sent3: The attic was a mothballing ground for forgotten treasures.
meanings.sent4: The mothballing of dreams can lead to a stagnant life.
meanings.sent5: The mothballing of the old factory left a ghostly silence in the air.
